basics.name: Sergio Acosta Quintana
basics.label: Backend Software Engineer | Java & Distributed Systems
basics.summary: Backend Engineer with production experience designing high-availability microservices for enterprise-scale environments (IKEA). Specialized in building fault-tolerant distributed systems using Spring Boot, Kafka, and AWS. Proven track record of reducing data processing latency by 55% through automation. Focused on Clean Architecture, database optimization, and CI/CD reliability.

work.name: IKEA / BITBOX S.L.
highlights: Built high-throughput Spring Boot microservices supporting IKEA's loyalty platform, handling transactions for 400,000+ active users.
Migrated legacy PL/SQL monoliths to an Event-Driven Architecture using Apache Kafka, significantly improving system fault tolerance.
Automated data pipelines to replace 7 manual batch jobs, reducing processing time by 55% and eliminating manual maintenance.
Designed and implemented a multi-insurance provider aggregation system for retail insurance, using event-driven microservices to decouple provider integrations.

projects.name: NEXO CLOUD (SaaS)
highlights: Built a cloud-native RAG backend using Spring Boot, Redis queues, and Cloudflare R2 for scalable document storage and vector search.
Implemented asynchronous document processing pipeline handling 1,000+ documents/hour with p99 latency under 200ms.
Integrated OpenAI API and custom LLM endpoints, reducing infrastructure costs by 30% through optimized caching and request batching.

education.institution: University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
